name: gdb-workshop
body:
gdb-workshop
============

Learn How to GDB. GDB is an incredibly powerful C/C++ debugging tool. Learn to use it at its full potential - it'll save lots of time and tears.

This is the companion website to the talk given on Sept. 28, 2014 at The George Washington University. The talk was given by [Phil Lopreiato](https://github.com/phil-lopreiato) and [Neel Shah](https://github.com/nks5295). The repository contains all of the code used to accompany the talk, as well as some helpful documents. Our slides are embedded below.

Useful Links
------------

GDB Homepage: http://www.gnu.org/software/gdb/ 

RMS's GDB Tutorial: http://www.unknownroad.com/rtfm/gdbtut/ 

GDB Cheat Sheat: http://darkdust.net/files/GDB%20Cheat%20Sheet.pdf

GDB to LLDB Map: http://lldb.llvm.org/lldb-gdb.html
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
